text: For complicity with the witch the cat had been caged. The inquisitioners suspected that the devil might have hidden under the skin of the cat and was sentenced to burn in a separate pyre, because there could have been a sin of bestiality by burning human and animal in the same bonfire. Well chained, the witch cat produced a chill among the faith-car attendees. There was some luciferian hunting in the cat's presence. The firewood of propitiation began to burn and for a long time the sound of hellish mourning was heard, until at last, the fire consumed, two ugly, unquenchable ashes were seen on the ashes, the cat's two phosphorescent eyes. FIN
title: Brujería del gato
author: Ramón Gómez de la Serna
